description.narrative:
Project name: "Project for Promotion of Hygiene and sanitation in the regions Nord, Centre-Nord and Centre-Sud in Burkina Faso 2018-2022"
Agreement partner : WaterAid Burkina Faso.
Consortium members for implementation: WaterAid and Eau Vive. They will work with the national Sanitation Board.
Activity period: 1 July 2018 - 31 December 2022
Amount of financial support by Sida: 79 000 000 SEK (95% of the project's total cost) Funds transfers :
1. Sida to WaterAid (95 %of the total budget) 2. WaterAid to Eau Vive (29%), SEI (2,6%) and local NGOs/local Governments (32%) 3. Local NGOs/local Governments A to local Associations A (11%) 4. Eau Vive to local NGOs/local Governments (16%) 5. local NGOs/local Governments B to local Associations B (5,6%)
The activities take 59.7% of the budget, monitoring and evaluation (monitoring meetings at the municipal / regional / national level, evaluations, capitalization, production of articles and films, field monitoring etc.) estimated at 11.1%.
50% of the total budget is used for "Investment Related Technical Cooperation (IRTC)" in that the share of physical investments is estimated at 27.6% of the budget and includes: subsidies for family latrines and catch basins, latrines realizations / rehabilitations for health centers and schools, boreholes, school gardens, Sludge treatment plant and unloading sites, etc.
The target groups (households, craftsmen masons, store managers, sanitation service providers, students, associations, communal technical services)/ will according to estimates receive at least 49% of the budget, including investments.
Project sites: Central-North, North, Central-South Regions
Background
The project’s overarching aim is to help improve sustainable and equitable access to safe water and sanitation for communities in 3 regions of Burkina Faso.
Specific Objectives are : - Sustainable access to hygiene, sanitation and safe water to communities in North, Central-North and Central-South regions - Increased reuse of sanitation by-products at school and community levels - Increased number of local service providers managing waste water and human waste - Improved local governance in managment of safe water, waste water and excreta.
The target groups are : - communities in all three (3) regions/North, Central North and Central South ; - children, particularly girls, in and outside schools; - local masons, Hygiene Promotion Volunteers (HPV, Community health workers, local service providers); - youth and women associations, - businesses promoting management of waste water and excreta - partner NGOs, - local Governments/municipalities in the 3 regions ; - regional boards for: water & sanitation, health, education and agriculture in the 3 regions.

Projektnamn: "Sanitet, hälsa, motståndskraft och trygg vattenförsörjning i regionerna Nord, Centre-Nord och Centre-Sud i Burkina Faso 2018-2022"
Avtalspartner: WaterAid Burkina Faso.
Konsortiemedlemmar för implementering: WaterAid och Eau Vive. De kommer att arbeta med det nationella sanitetsverket.
Aktivitetsperiod: 1 juli 2018 - 31 december 2022
Finansiellt stöd från Sida: 79 000 000 kr (95% av projektets totala kostnad).
Finansiella transfereringar:
1. Sida till WaterAid 95% av totala budgeten 2. WaterAid vidareförmedlar till Eau Vive (29% av sitt bidrag), SEI (2,6%) och lokala icke-statliga organisationer / kommuner (32%) 3. Lokala icke-statliga organisationer / kommuner vidareförmedlar till lokala föreningar (11%) 4. Eau Vive vidareförmdelar till lokala icke-statliga organisationer / kommuner (16%) 5. Lokala icke-statliga organisationer / lokakommuner vidareförmedlar till lokala föreningar (5,6%)
För aktiviteter planeras 59,7% av budgeten. Fältuppföljning, utvärdering & kommunikation inkl möten på kommunal / regional / nationell nivå, utvärderingar, kapitalisering, artiklar och filmer etc.) uppskattas till 11,1%. 50% av den totala budgeten används för "Investment Related Technical Cooperation (IRTC)", eftersom andelen fysiska investeringar uppskattas till 27,6% av budgeten och inkluderar subventioner för familjelatriner och fängelseinterner, latriner för hälsocenter och skolor, borrhål, skolor, slamhanteringsanläggningar och sopanläggningar etc.
Målgrupperna (hushåll, hantverkare, murare, sanitärtjänsteleverantörer, studenter, föreningar, kommunala tekniska tjänster) beräknas dra direkt nytta av 49% av budgeten, inklusive investeringar.
Projektområden: Regionerna Central-North, North, Central-South
Bakgrund
Projektets övergripande mål är att bidra till en hållbar och rättvis tillgång till säker vatten och sanitet för samhällen i tre regioner i Burkina Faso.
Specifika mål är: - Hållbar tillgång till hygien, sanitet och rent vatten till samhällen i norra, centrala och nord-sydliga regioner - Ökad återanvändning av biprodukter av sanitet på skolan och på kommunnivå - Ökat antal lokala tjänsteleverantörer som hanterar avloppsvatten och mänskligt avfall - Förbättrat lokalt styre i hantering av rent vatten, avloppsvatten och excreta.
Målgrupperna är: - befolkningen i alla tre (3) regionerna/North, Central North and Central South; - barn, i synnerhet flickor, såväl inom som utom skolor; - Lokala murare, Hygien Promotion Volunteers (HPV, hälsoarbetare, lokala tjänsteleverantörer); - Ungdoms- och kvinnoförbund; - Företag inom förvaltning av avloppsvatten och excreta; - NGO-partners; - kommuner i de tre regionerna; - Regionala styrelser för vatten och sanitet, hälsa, utbildning och jordbruk i de tre regionerna.

The projects aim is to help improve sustainable and equitable access to safe water and sanitation for communities in the regions Nord, Centre-Nord &Centre-Sud in Burkina Faso. The specific objectives are: Provide sustainable access to hygiene, sanitation and safe water services to communities in North, Central-North and Central-South regions, Promote the reuse of sanitation by-products at school and community levels, Foster the development of local service providers to manage waste water and excreta and Improve local governance on safe water and management of waste water and excreta. The project will help to address the root causes of safe water and sanitation issues in communities, households, health centers and schools through creating demand from community members; offer quality sanitation; support municipalities to effectively and efficiently manage projects and delivery of safe water and sanitation to school children. Expected outcomes are : -19 000 households have access to waste water and excreta management services - 250 000 people display good hygiene practices - 14 health care facilities provided with facilities to manage waste water and excreta - 10 000 school children have access to sustainable safe water, hygiene and sanitation, including Menstrual Hygiene Management - 13 blue schools are created - 3 clean and productive communities exist - 5 initiatives are supported to develop and promote sanitation by-products - 25 women associations and 25 youth associations become professional in managing waste water and excreta - 750 local masons and 25 sanitation shop managers/attendants and 25 manual pit cleaners/emptiers are operational - 2 eco-business are set up for management of excreta and waste water - local authorities leadership has increased - communities are empowered to claim their rights of access to sustainable safe water and sanitation services - local accountability platforms are created and operational

description.narrative:
Cooperation between the Embassy and the partner
As in the previous three years, cooperation with WaterAid, the lead implementing partner, went well during 2021. It resulted :
- fluid communication and rapid feedback on the files to be submitted,
- close collaboration in the budget review to free up resources to help meet the demand for WASH services from Internally Displaced Persons,
- participation and organization of field visit concerning a school garden as well as other achievements of the project at the Kayao school in May 2021,
- participation in the seminar on "Multidimensional poverty in Burkina Faso" organized by the Swedish Embassy on June 09, 2021.
Capacity of the partner and of his collaborators to carry out activities
The capacities of the partner and its collaborators to carry out the project in 2021 are evaluated as follows:
At the central level: WaterAid is an international organization which has policy documents on occupational health and safety. A regular update is made with the stakeholders in the implementation of the project. The central coordination team has over 15 years of experience in project and program management and multi-actor partnership management. The coordination team receives support from WaterAid and Eau Vive headquarters for the proper implementation of the project. WaterAid has a contingency plan that is updated to address the health and security challenges of the project area
At the regional level: the project is implemented in the three (03) regions by three (03) NGO partners who have more than 10 years of experience in the implementation of projects and programs. They also have the advantage of being in these regions with a good knowledge of socio-cultural realities. There is good collaboration with the state technical services for sovereign monitoring and support in the implementation of the project.
At the municipal level: the project intervention municipalities are committed and empowered for the implementation of the project, as evidenced by the recruitment of Municipal Water and Sanitation Technicians (and their support from municipal budgets) to support municipal councils for the project implementation.
In term of financial/ Budget implementation, 2020 audit report was received and analyzed as well as the plan for implementing the recommendations.
Examples of the results that have been achieved, both expected and
unexpected in 2021:
The main results achieved in 2021 are:
- 19 929 family latrines built for the benefit of vulnerable households in the project regions, corresponding to a rate of 111% achieved compared to the project objective.
- 100 villages potentially End of Open Defecation equivalent to 111% execution rate.
- 50 local associations trained in the management of the sanitation chain and the promotion of hygiene. These associations are operational in the 24/25 municipalities of intervention, corresponding to a rate of 100% compared to the project objective.
- 775 local masons trained and able to build family latrines for the communities in the project communes, equivalent to 99% achievement.
- 24/25 municipalities with a technical service for the management of drinking water, hygiene and sanitation, equivalent to 99% achievement. The provision of technical water management services not carried out in the commune of Ouindigui alone due to the security situation.
- 108 local elected officials and Municipal Water and Sanitation Technicians trained on municipal project management approach and Human Rights-Based Approach, equivalent to 99% achievement.
- 507,224 women and girls were reached by awareness campaigns Information on Behavior Change, equivalent to 390% achievement in relation to the project objective.
- 26 sanitation structures constructed/rehabilitated in schools and health centers, equivalent to 100% achievement rate.
- 50 schools have actors trained in the Hygienic Management of Menstruation; schools clubs set up functional ones.
- 35 Hygienic Menstrual Management cabins built, equipped and used by 5 250 girls, equivalent to 117% achievement rate.
Brief analysis of satisfactions and dissatisfactions:
In terms of results obtained in 2021, the main satisfactions are as follows:
- The construction of 19 229 latrines in the three (03) regions of the project, including more than 7 000 latrines in the center, has contributed to advancing this region from the last (16% in 2018) to 4th place at the national level in more than 20 % sanitation rate. The successful implementation of the blue school initiative in the 24 schools has generated national interest. The Ministry of Agriculture requests learning exchanges with WaterAid in order to share experience to strengthen the presidential program one pupil, one daily quality food.
- 24/25 municipalities with a technical service for the management of drinking water, hygiene and sanitation. Only the municipality of Ouindigui did not benefit from it due to the security situation.
- 26 sanitation structures constructed/rehabilitated in schools and health centers.
- 50 youth and women's associations are operational.
There were no expected negative results. Regarding the positive results, the blue school approach has spread. Indeed two (02) schools (one in the North Center and the other in the North) in view of the blue schools of neighboring municipalities, have taken the initiative to set up and operate their school gardens.
Changes observed in the context of applying the theory of change: In this project, the theory of change is the improvement of governance and the empowerment of municipalities in a transfer of competence in terms of sanitation and drinking water from the State to communities with sufficient accompanying measures. The major changes observed in 2021 are as follows:
- 23/24 municipalities were supported to recruit municipal Water and Sanitation Technicians with their inclusion in the municipal budgets so that they are eventually agents of the municipalities,
- 50 associations of young people and women have been recruited by the municipalities and have seen their capacities strengthened and these associations constitute local expertise for the promotion of hygiene and sanitation,
- 24 blue schools are operational with the support of the municipalities, thus improving the quality of food rations in the endogenous canteens of these schools,
- The 24 municipalities of intervention are favorable to the promotion of menstrual hygiene at school,
- More than 19,000 family latrines are built and well used by households in the communes.
Consideration of perspectives (poverty, environment and climate, gender, human rights, conflict)
Issue of poverty: This issue has been considered in the implementation of project activities in 2021 through the granting of the total subsidy to very poor households and people with disabilities.
About Gender: This issue was taken into account through:
- Equitable support for the professionalization of associations of young people and women involved in the promotion of WASH in the municipalities,
- Organization of awareness-raising meetings on good hygiene practices for groups of women, men and children in the project villages,
- Monitoring the effective implementation of Menstrual Hygiene Management action plans in schools and the functionality of Menstrual Hygienic Management cabins with the aim of promoting effective participation of girls in school activities even during their periods of menstruation,
- Arrangements are made to ensure the participation of all actors in the implementation of the project for the sustainability of actions.
In terms of considering the Environment and the climate: This issue has been considered in:
- The construction of institutional sanitation works and for the benefit of households: the project team takes into account the national standard which is to build all sanitation works at least 25 m from water points to avoid the risk of groundwater contamination.
- For the drilling of boreholes, the project team ensures a distance of at least 500 m between two (02) boreholes to avoid the risk of pressure on the water table.
- Concerning construction of the Ouahigouya Faecal Sludge Treatment Station, an environmental impact study has been carried out.
Regarding Human Rights : This issue was taken into account through:
- The creation of adapted Hygienic Menstrual Management cabins and the promotion of Hygienic Menstrual Management in schools aims to ensure that girls have the same opportunities and the same rights as boys to participate in school activities.
- Conducting capacity building sessions for elected officials and municipal executives on the Human Rights-Based Approach, particularly on the specific issue of WASH,
- Volunteer hygienists are identified in male-female pairs to carry out Information Education Communication actions and Home Visits.
Consideration of Conflict: In this context,
- Before implementation, the project ensures that the institutional hydraulic and sanitation works are not located in areas subject to community conflicts,
- All awareness-raising actions are implemented in concert with the various social groups and community leaders.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
